comments:
Build ID: M20070212-1330

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Add a new extension to be opened by XML Editor in preferences -> Editor -> File association (chose *.xlex)
2.Open this type of file with "Open with" "XML Editor"
3.XML Editor spawns an "unexpected exception": NPE


More information:
Here is the stack trace:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui.StructuredTextEditor.update(StructuredTextEditor.java:3047)
	at org.eclipse.wst.xml.ui.internal.tabletree.XMLMultiPageEditorPart.addSourcePage(XMLMultiPageEditorPart.java:338)

	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorReference.getEditor(EditorReference.java:214)

	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2856)

	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)

The real problem is that you need to also associate your extension with the XML content type.  See FAQ item "How do I use my own filename extensions in the XML editor? It only works correctly if a file ends with .xml. " for more details: http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/faq/main.html#xml_1

You should have gotten an "Unsupported Content Type" dialog informing you of the problem when you opened the editor.  When I tried to reproduce this scenario, I saw that after the NPE was thrown and an error dialog popped up, the "Unsupported Content Type" dialog would show up after that.  I'll use this bug to fix the NPE that appears beforehand.

Fix was to remove the call to StructuredTextEditor.update() in XMLMultiPageEditorPart.addSourcePage().  

There was a comment before the call stating calling update() was critical to get viewer selection manager & highlighting to work, but I think that's an old/outdated comment since viewer selection manager no longer exists and how the editor sets up highlighting has changed a bit. (I also verified selection & highlighting seemed to work without the update() call)
*** Bug 193723 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
